hi and welcome you listening to the x22
rapport my name is Dave and this is
episode 1325 a and today's date is July
6 2017 and the top of the episode is
countries are now moving to nationalize
their private western central bank let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now with each passing day we are
looking at more and more indicators and
we can see there are some indicators
that are just completely flashing red
signals saying warning warning we're in
a recession or we're entering recession
and it's following the same pattern that
we saw back in 2007 moving into 2008 and
we are getting many more indicators and
let me tell you it's really starting to
look very similar to what happened back
now ADP they came out with their
employment numbers and it looks like
they went ahead and they had to revise
the main numbers and when we look at the
main numbers they reported that there
were about two hundred and fifty-three
thousand jobs that were added and they
had to bring it down to two hundred and
thirty thousand which probably most
likely they will once again go ahead and
revise those numbers once again now it
looks like the June numbers it looks
like the jobs have only come in around
one hundred and fifty-eight thousand
they expected one hundred and eighty
eight thousand and we can see there was
no manufacturing jobs that were added
there were no gains during this month
whatsoever and we need to understand
that a lot of these job numbers even
with ADP we know definitely with the BLS
they are completely manipulated to
basically paint this narrative that
everything is fine in the job market and
we've been seeing jobs being let go left
and right
I mean retail is one of the biggest
industries right now where jobs are just
being shed like crazy and we're looking
at the automotive industry and it looks
like they are in a lot of trouble now
O'Reilly Automotive
their stock has crashed as much as 21%
and when we look at this we can see that
the oral part retailer says that their
same store sales well they have
completely missed the forecast for the
second quarter when we look at advanced
autoparts they plunge 16% AutoZone they
tumble 10% standard Motor Products they
are down and what we're seeing is that
the auto part industry well it is
crashing right now now we take this a
step further and we look at the entire
automotive industry we can see that the
automotive industry has built has been
built on a gigantic illusion of debt and
what has happened here is for people to
basically buy these cars and actually
they're not really buying them they're
taking out a loan on these cars and many
of these cars are leased they're not
even owning or renting them well this is
how the auto industry got by now when we
look at this we can see that things are
slowing down dramatically in fact the
overall industrial production is
actually no higher today than it was in
the fall of 2007 that means there has
been zero growth in the aggregate
industrial economy for a full decade
real production in most sectors of the
US economy has actually shrunk but has
been partially offset by a 15 percent
gain in auto production from the prior
peak now auto production well it's
starting to decline now so if this
so-called recovery loses the automotive
production that basically boosted up the
entire economy where will the growth
come from this is the big question
because it will completely collapse at
this point so let's think about this all
this for a second how did US households
afford to buy their new cars when their
incomes have lagged the purchase price
of a new car by nearly one-third over
the last two decades
well they didn't now to finance an
average new vehicle
it amounts to around thirty thousand
nine hundred forty five dollars or
ninety seven point six percent of the
average purchase price that's up 29%
from the Great Recession and shows quite
dramatically how the feds bubble finance
actually works now since about eighty
five percent or so of new cars are
financed it means that households they
are taking out cash to finance the
transaction fees maybe pay off
underwater loans or trade-ins and we
could see that they really don't have
the cash to actually purchase these
autos and we know they continually lower
the requirements for individuals to take
out loans to subprime the sub subprime
anyone with a breath they'll just allow
anyone to take out a loan now the feds
survey shows that household sector is
tapped out on auto credit and that the

the first time since 2008 2009 current
paychecks are barely keeping up with
inflation and this means the auto
industry well they are in trouble and
this is why we see car sales declining
and remember how car sales are
calculated when these cars are channels
stuffed into the Lots that is considered
a sale not when they actually sell them
to a person now when we start to take a
look at the entire economy we can see
that things are changing not for the

coming out of Moneyball economics this
is Andrew zetlen and he's using this
vais index to basically look at the

shows that the spending growth is
continually slowing in fact in the
latest month it points to a contraction
in the third quarter and the fourth
quarter now we're already slowing down
in retail because we can see it it's
right in front of our
actually if we go back in time we've
been looking at this and we've been
watching it slow over time and we can
see that retail spending well it is
dropped by five point six percent
year-over-year and this tells us that
guess what people just don't have the
extra funds now according to this vise
Index income growth has also slowed so
has personal consumption expenditures
and this is after gas price inflation
has moderated so when we look at this we
can see that compensation received
year-on-year it's continually declining
this is why we see the problem in retail
this is why we see the problem o Beals
is why we see the problem throughout the
economy when we look at revolving credit
revolving credit has rolled over when
did we see this before that's right
prior to 2008 where consumer credit
rolled over and we're seeing the same

most of the Weisse index data and if we

when we're looking at housing that is
declining this is a signal that the

there's many other indicators I mean I
can go on with this long list of many
many indicators showing that we are in

basically look at it and say you know
what I don't believe in this system
anymore I don't believe that this is

many more people are out of work many
more people can't
fine work more and more retail sales
stores are closing the only thing that

because the central bankers the
government they figured that one out
because think about it if we took away

bread lines soup lines we would see
people looking for places to live we

million people that are on food stamps
think about the lines of people looking
for food it would be unbelievable and

this is what they saw back in the Great

most of the people in 2008 didn't

time it's going to be much higher now
out in South Africa they are in a

Congress right now is proposing that the

state now of course the central bankers

going to get a lot worse well this is

decide to do anything against what we're

that things will get a lot better once
the people take control of the banking
system but the central bankers they

remember their entire company their
entire corporation which these private
western central banks are their product
is debt they deal in debt and if you

people take control of the bank guess
what you're controlling everything and
in today's world once this global

basically taken over by the people and
most likely what we need to do is get

bank's completely and let the people

to create the currency without interest
attached this is the big sticking point
because once you get rid of that
interest you get rid of a lot of the

issue a currency there's no debt
attached to it and it can go out to the
people and the currency can actually
have value now if you take that and you
attach it to maybe silver or gold where
there's checks and balances well then
you have something even better and this
is why China and Russia
they've been accumulating a lot of gold
and they're continually accumulating a
lot of gold because they realize when
the time comes they're going to need
that but they're going to use that goal
they're going to need that gold because
the dollar it will be worth absolutely
nothing the dollar will no longer exist
it will not be read the reserve currency
of the world and they're going to have
to resort to something completely
different and throughout history we've
seen this happen where there were
reserve currencies of the world and they
cease to exist and they are no longer
the reserve currencies of the world
we're going to see the same thing happen
once again we've reached that time
period
where the global economy has reached a

done as much manipulation as they
possibly can they can't do anything else
they're going to try but what happens
here it doesn't matter about the stock

when the banking system starts to fall

well the people start to say okay this

well this is never going to happen
it already has countries are

where they can manipulate everything and
this is just the beginning stages and
once this starts to grow and it gets

currency what
out of thin air the central bank creates

the crypto currency it's decentralized
it flows back to nobody because there's
